00060 static nfc_context *context;
00061 static nfc_device *pnd;
00062 static nfc_target nt;
00063 static mifare_param mp;
00064 static mifare_classic_tag mtKeys;
00065 static mifare_classic_tag mtDump;
00066 static bool bUseKeyA;
00067 static bool bUseKeyFile;
00068 static bool bForceKeyFile;
00069 static bool bTolerateFailures;
00070 static bool magic2 = false;
00071 static uint8_t uiBlocks;
00072 static uint8_t keys[] = {
00073   0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff,
00074   0xd3, 0xf7, 0xd3, 0xf7, 0xd3, 0xf7,
00075   0xa0, 0xa1, 0xa2, 0xa3, 0xa4, 0xa5,
00076   0xb0, 0xb1, 0xb2, 0xb3, 0xb4, 0xb5,
00077   0x4d, 0x3a, 0x99, 0xc3, 0x51, 0xdd,
00078   0x1a, 0x98, 0x2c, 0x7e, 0x45, 0x9a,
00079   0xaa, 0xbb, 0xcc, 0xdd, 0xee, 0xff,
00080   0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00,
00081   0xab, 0xcd, 0xef, 0x12, 0x34, 0x56
00082 };
00083 
00084 static const nfc_modulation nmMifare = {
00085   .nmt = NMT_ISO14443A,
00086   .nbr = NBR_106,
00087 };
00088 
00089 static size_t num_keys = sizeof(keys) / 6;
00090 
00091 #define MAX_FRAME_LEN 264
00092 
00093 static uint8_t abtRx[MAX_FRAME_LEN];
00094 static int szRxBits;
00095 
00096 uint8_t  abtHalt[4] = { 0x50, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00 };
00097 
00098 // special unlock command
00099 uint8_t  abtUnlock1[1] = { 0x40 };
00100 uint8_t  abtUnlock2[1] = { 0x43 };
00101 
00102 static  bool
00103 transmit_bits(const uint8_t *pbtTx, const size_t szTxBits)
00104 {
00105   // Show transmitted command
00106   printf("Sent bits:     ");
00107   print_hex_bits(pbtTx, szTxBits);
00108   // Transmit the bit frame command, we don't use the arbitrary parity feature
00109   if ((szRxBits = nfc_initiator_transceive_bits(pnd, pbtTx, szTxBits, NULL, abtRx, sizeof(abtRx), NULL)) < 0)
00110     return false;
00111 
00112   // Show received answer
00113   printf("Received bits: ");
00114   print_hex_bits(abtRx, szRxBits);
00115   // Succesful transfer
00116   return true;
00117 }
00118 
00119 
00120 static  bool
00121 transmit_bytes(const uint8_t *pbtTx, const size_t szTx)
00122 {
00123   // Show transmitted command
00124   printf("Sent bits:     ");
00125   print_hex(pbtTx, szTx);
00126   // Transmit the command bytes
00127   int res;
00128   if ((res = nfc_initiator_transceive_bytes(pnd, pbtTx, szTx, abtRx, sizeof(abtRx), 0)) < 0)
00129     return false;
00130 
00131   // Show received answer
00132   printf("Received bits: ");
00133   print_hex(abtRx, res);
00134   // Succesful transfer
00135   return true;
00136 }
00137 
00138 static void
00139 print_success_or_failure(bool bFailure, uint32_t *uiBlockCounter)
00140 {
00141   printf("%c", (bFailure) ? 'x' : '.');
00142   if (uiBlockCounter && !bFailure)
00143     *uiBlockCounter += 1;
00144 }
00145 
00146 static  bool
00147 is_first_block(uint32_t uiBlock)
00148 {
00149   // Test if we are in the small or big sectors
00150   if (uiBlock < 128)
00151     return ((uiBlock) % 4 == 0);
00152   else
00153     return ((uiBlock) % 16 == 0);
00154 }
00155 
00156 static  bool
00157 is_trailer_block(uint32_t uiBlock)
00158 {
00159   // Test if we are in the small or big sectors
00160   if (uiBlock < 128)
00161     return ((uiBlock + 1) % 4 == 0);
00162   else
00163     return ((uiBlock + 1) % 16 == 0);
00164 }
00165 
00166 static  uint32_t
00167 get_trailer_block(uint32_t uiFirstBlock)
00168 {
00169   // Test if we are in the small or big sectors
00170   uint32_t trailer_block = 0;
00171   if (uiFirstBlock < 128) {
00172     trailer_block = uiFirstBlock + (3 - (uiFirstBlock % 4));
00173   } else {
00174     trailer_block = uiFirstBlock + (15 - (uiFirstBlock % 16));
00175   }
00176   return trailer_block;
00177 }
00178 
00179 static  bool
00180 authenticate(uint32_t uiBlock)
00181 {
00182   mifare_cmd mc;
00183   uint32_t uiTrailerBlock;
00184 
00185   // Set the authentication information (uid)
00186   memcpy(mp.mpa.abtAuthUid, nt.nti.nai.abtUid + nt.nti.nai.szUidLen - 4, 4);
00187 
00188   // Should we use key A or B?
00189   mc = (bUseKeyA) ? MC_AUTH_A : MC_AUTH_B;
00190 
00191   // Key file authentication.
00192   if (bUseKeyFile) {
00193 
00194     // Locate the trailer (with the keys) used for this sector
00195     uiTrailerBlock = get_trailer_block(uiBlock);
00196 
00197     // Extract the right key from dump file
00198     if (bUseKeyA)
00199       memcpy(mp.mpa.abtKey, mtKeys.amb[uiTrailerBlock].mbt.abtKeyA, 6);
00200     else
00201       memcpy(mp.mpa.abtKey, mtKeys.amb[uiTrailerBlock].mbt.abtKeyB, 6);
00202 
00203     // Try to authenticate for the current sector
00204     if (nfc_initiator_mifare_cmd(pnd, mc, uiBlock, &mp))
00205       return true;
00206   } else {
00207     // Try to guess the right key
00208     for (size_t key_index = 0; key_index < num_keys; key_index++) {
00209       memcpy(mp.mpa.abtKey, keys + (key_index * 6), 6);
00210       if (nfc_initiator_mifare_cmd(pnd, mc, uiBlock, &mp)) {
00211         if (bUseKeyA)
00212           memcpy(mtKeys.amb[uiBlock].mbt.abtKeyA, &mp.mpa.abtKey, 6);
00213         else
00214           memcpy(mtKeys.amb[uiBlock].mbt.abtKeyB, &mp.mpa.abtKey, 6);
00215         return true;
00216       }
00217       nfc_initiator_select_passive_target(pnd, nmMifare, nt.nti.nai.abtUid, nt.nti.nai.szUidLen, NULL);
00218     }
00219   }
00220 
00221   return false;
00222 }
00223 
00224 static bool
00225 unlock_card(void)
00226 {
00227   if (magic2) {
00228     printf("Don't use R/W with this card, this is not required!\n");
00229     return false;
00230   }
00231 
00232   // Configure the CRC
00233   if (nfc_device_set_property_bool(pnd, NP_HANDLE_CRC, false) < 0) {
00234     nfc_perror(pnd, "nfc_configure");
00235     return false;
00236   }
00237   // Use raw send/receive methods
00238   if (nfc_device_set_property_bool(pnd, NP_EASY_FRAMING, false) < 0) {
00239     nfc_perror(pnd, "nfc_configure");
00240     return false;
00241   }
00242 
00243   iso14443a_crc_append(abtHalt, 2);
00244   transmit_bytes(abtHalt, 4);
00245   // now send unlock
00246   if (!transmit_bits(abtUnlock1, 7)) {
00247     printf("unlock failure!\n");
00248     return false;
00249   }
00250   if (!transmit_bytes(abtUnlock2, 1)) {
00251     printf("unlock failure!\n");
00252     return false;
00253   }
00254 
00255   // reset reader
00256   // Configure the CRC
00257   if (nfc_device_set_property_bool(pnd, NP_HANDLE_CRC, true) < 0) {
00258     nfc_perror(pnd, "nfc_device_set_property_bool");
00259     return false;
00260   }
00261   // Switch off raw send/receive methods
00262   if (nfc_device_set_property_bool(pnd, NP_EASY_FRAMING, true) < 0) {
00263     nfc_perror(pnd, "nfc_device_set_property_bool");
00264     return false;
00265   }
00266   return true;
00267 }
00268 
00269 static int
00270 get_rats(void)
00271 {
00272   int res;
00273   uint8_t  abtRats[2] = { 0xe0, 0x50};
00274   // Use raw send/receive methods
00275   if (nfc_device_set_property_bool(pnd, NP_EASY_FRAMING, false) < 0) {
00276     nfc_perror(pnd, "nfc_configure");
00277     return -1;
00278   }
00279   res = nfc_initiator_transceive_bytes(pnd, abtRats, sizeof(abtRats), abtRx, sizeof(abtRx), 0);
00280   if (res > 0) {
00281     // ISO14443-4 card, turn RF field off/on to access ISO14443-3 again
00282     nfc_device_set_property_bool(pnd, NP_ACTIVATE_FIELD, false);
00283     nfc_device_set_property_bool(pnd, NP_ACTIVATE_FIELD, true);
00284   }
00285   // Reselect tag
00286   if (nfc_initiator_select_passive_target(pnd, nmMifare, NULL, 0, &nt) <= 0) {
00287     printf("Error: tag disappeared\n");
00288     nfc_close(pnd);
00289     nfc_exit(context);
00290     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00291   }
00292   return res;
00293 }
00294 
00295 static  bool
00296 read_card(int read_unlocked)
00297 {
00298   int32_t iBlock;
00299   bool    bFailure = false;
00300   uint32_t uiReadBlocks = 0;
00301 
00302   if (read_unlocked)
00303     if (!unlock_card())
00304       return false;
00305 
00306   printf("Reading out %d blocks |", uiBlocks + 1);
00307   // Read the card from end to begin
00308   for (iBlock = uiBlocks; iBlock >= 0; iBlock--) {
00309     // Authenticate everytime we reach a trailer block
00310     if (is_trailer_block(iBlock)) {
00311       if (bFailure) {
00312         // When a failure occured we need to redo the anti-collision
00313         if (nfc_initiator_select_passive_target(pnd, nmMifare, NULL, 0, &nt) <= 0) {
00314           printf("!\nError: tag was removed\n");
00315           return false;
00316         }
00317         bFailure = false;
00318       }
00319 
00320       fflush(stdout);
00321 
00322       // Try to authenticate for the current sector
00323       if (!read_unlocked && !authenticate(iBlock)) {
00324         printf("!\nError: authentication failed for block 0x%02x\n", iBlock);
00325         return false;
00326       }
00327       // Try to read out the trailer
00328       if (nfc_initiator_mifare_cmd(pnd, MC_READ, iBlock, &mp)) {
00329         if (read_unlocked) {
00330           memcpy(mtDump.amb[iBlock].mbd.abtData, mp.mpd.abtData, 16);
00331         } else {
00332           // Copy the keys over from our key dump and store the retrieved access bits
00333           memcpy(mtDump.amb[iBlock].mbt.abtKeyA, mtKeys.amb[iBlock].mbt.abtKeyA, 6);
00334           memcpy(mtDump.amb[iBlock].mbt.abtAccessBits, mp.mpd.abtData + 6, 4);
00335           memcpy(mtDump.amb[iBlock].mbt.abtKeyB, mtKeys.amb[iBlock].mbt.abtKeyB, 6);
00336         }
00337       } else {
00338         printf("!\nfailed to read trailer block 0x%02x\n", iBlock);
00339         bFailure = true;
00340       }
00341     } else {
00342       // Make sure a earlier readout did not fail
00343       if (!bFailure) {
00344         // Try to read out the data block
00345         if (nfc_initiator_mifare_cmd(pnd, MC_READ, iBlock, &mp)) {
00346           memcpy(mtDump.amb[iBlock].mbd.abtData, mp.mpd.abtData, 16);
00347         } else {
00348           printf("!\nError: unable to read block 0x%02x\n", iBlock);
00349           bFailure = true;
00350         }
00351       }
00352     }
00353     // Show if the readout went well for each block
00354     print_success_or_failure(bFailure, &uiReadBlocks);
00355     if ((! bTolerateFailures) && bFailure)
00356       return false;
00357   }
00358   printf("|\n");
00359   printf("Done, %d of %d blocks read.\n", uiReadBlocks, uiBlocks + 1);
00360   fflush(stdout);
00361 
00362   return true;
00363 }
00364 
00365 static  bool
00366 write_card(int write_block_zero)
00367 {
00368   uint32_t uiBlock;
00369   bool    bFailure = false;
00370   uint32_t uiWriteBlocks = 0;
00371 
00372   if (write_block_zero)
00373     if (!unlock_card())
00374       return false;
00375 
00376   printf("Writing %d blocks |", uiBlocks + 1);
00377   // Write the card from begin to end;
00378   for (uiBlock = 0; uiBlock <= uiBlocks; uiBlock++) {
00379     // Authenticate everytime we reach the first sector of a new block
00380     if (is_first_block(uiBlock)) {
00381       if (bFailure) {
00382         // When a failure occured we need to redo the anti-collision
00383         if (nfc_initiator_select_passive_target(pnd, nmMifare, NULL, 0, &nt) <= 0) {
00384           printf("!\nError: tag was removed\n");
00385           return false;
00386         }
00387         bFailure = false;
00388       }
00389 
00390       fflush(stdout);
00391 
00392       // Try to authenticate for the current sector
00393       if (!write_block_zero && !authenticate(uiBlock)) {
00394         printf("!\nError: authentication failed for block %02x\n", uiBlock);
00395         return false;
00396       }
00397     }
00398 
00399     if (is_trailer_block(uiBlock)) {
00400       // Copy the keys over from our key dump and store the retrieved access bits
00401       memcpy(mp.mpd.abtData, mtDump.amb[uiBlock].mbt.abtKeyA, 6);
00402       memcpy(mp.mpd.abtData + 6, mtDump.amb[uiBlock].mbt.abtAccessBits, 4);
00403       memcpy(mp.mpd.abtData + 10, mtDump.amb[uiBlock].mbt.abtKeyB, 6);
00404 
00405       // Try to write the trailer
00406       if (nfc_initiator_mifare_cmd(pnd, MC_WRITE, uiBlock, &mp) == false) {
00407         printf("failed to write trailer block %d \n", uiBlock);
00408         bFailure = true;
00409       }
00410     } else {
00411       // The first block 0x00 is read only, skip this
00412       if (uiBlock == 0 && ! write_block_zero && ! magic2)
00413         continue;
00414 
00415 
00416       // Make sure a earlier write did not fail
00417       if (!bFailure) {
00418         // Try to write the data block
00419         memcpy(mp.mpd.abtData, mtDump.amb[uiBlock].mbd.abtData, 16);
00420         // do not write a block 0 with incorrect BCC - card will be made invalid!
00421         if (uiBlock == 0) {
00422           if ((mp.mpd.abtData[0] ^ mp.mpd.abtData[1] ^ mp.mpd.abtData[2] ^ mp.mpd.abtData[3] ^ mp.mpd.abtData[4]) != 0x00 && !magic2) {
00423             printf("!\nError: incorrect BCC in MFD file!\n");
00424             printf("Expecting BCC=%02X\n", mp.mpd.abtData[0] ^ mp.mpd.abtData[1] ^ mp.mpd.abtData[2] ^ mp.mpd.abtData[3]);
00425             return false;
00426           }
00427         }
00428         if (!nfc_initiator_mifare_cmd(pnd, MC_WRITE, uiBlock, &mp))
00429           bFailure = true;
00430       }
00431     }
00432     // Show if the write went well for each block
00433     print_success_or_failure(bFailure, &uiWriteBlocks);
00434     if ((! bTolerateFailures) && bFailure)
00435       return false;
00436   }
00437   printf("|\n");
00438   printf("Done, %d of %d blocks written.\n", uiWriteBlocks, uiBlocks + 1);
00439   fflush(stdout);
00440 
00441   return true;
00442 }
00443 
00444 typedef enum {
00445   ACTION_READ,
00446   ACTION_WRITE,
00447   ACTION_USAGE
00448 } action_t;
00449 
00450 static void
00451 print_usage(const char *pcProgramName)
00452 {
00453   printf("Usage: ");
00454   printf("%s r|R|w|W a|b <dump.mfd> [<keys.mfd> [f]]\n", pcProgramName);
00455   printf("  r|R|w|W       - Perform read from (r) or unlocked read from (R) or write to (w) or unlocked write to (W) card\n");
00456   printf("                  *** note that unlocked write will attempt to overwrite block 0 including UID\n");
00457   printf("                  *** unlocked read does not require authentication and will reveal A and B keys\n");
00458   printf("                  *** unlocking only works with special Mifare 1K cards (Chinese clones)\n");
00459   printf("  a|A|b|B       - Use A or B keys for action; Halt on errors (a|b) or tolerate errors (A|B)\n");
00460   printf("  <dump.mfd>    - MiFare Dump (MFD) used to write (card to MFD) or (MFD to card)\n");
00461   printf("  <keys.mfd>    - MiFare Dump (MFD) that contain the keys (optional)\n");
00462   printf("  f             - Force using the keyfile even if UID does not match (optional)\n");
00463 }
00464 
00465 int
00466 main(int argc, const char *argv[])
00467 {
00468   action_t atAction = ACTION_USAGE;
00469   uint8_t *pbtUID;
00470   int    unlock = 0;
00471 
00472   if (argc < 2) {
00473     print_usage(argv[0]);
00474     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00475   }
00476   const char *command = argv[1];
00477 
00478   if (strcmp(command, "r") == 0 || strcmp(command, "R") == 0) {
00479     if (argc < 4) {
00480       print_usage(argv[0]);
00481       exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00482     }
00483     atAction = ACTION_READ;
00484     if (strcmp(command, "R") == 0)
00485       unlock = 1;
00486     bUseKeyA = tolower((int)((unsigned char) * (argv[2]))) == 'a';
00487     bTolerateFailures = tolower((int)((unsigned char) * (argv[2]))) != (int)((unsigned char) * (argv[2]));
00488     bUseKeyFile = (argc > 4);
00489   } else if (strcmp(command, "w") == 0 || strcmp(command, "W") == 0) {
00490     if (argc < 4) {
00491       print_usage(argv[0]);
00492       exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00493     }
00494     atAction = ACTION_WRITE;
00495     if (strcmp(command, "W") == 0)
00496       unlock = 1;
00497     bUseKeyA = tolower((int)((unsigned char) * (argv[2]))) == 'a';
00498     bTolerateFailures = tolower((int)((unsigned char) * (argv[2]))) != (int)((unsigned char) * (argv[2]));
00499     bUseKeyFile = (argc > 4);
00500     bForceKeyFile = ((argc > 5) && (strcmp((char *)argv[5], "f") == 0));
00501   }
00502 
00503   if (atAction == ACTION_USAGE) {
00504     print_usage(argv[0]);
00505     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00506   }
00507   // We don't know yet the card size so let's read only the UID from the keyfile for the moment
00508   if (bUseKeyFile) {
00509     FILE *pfKeys = fopen(argv[4], "rb");
00510     if (pfKeys == NULL) {
00511       printf("Could not open keys file: %s\n", argv[4]);
00512       exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00513     }
00514     if (fread(&mtKeys, 1, 4, pfKeys) != 4) {
00515       printf("Could not read UID from key file: %s\n", argv[4]);
00516       fclose(pfKeys);
00517       exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00518     }
00519     fclose(pfKeys);
00520   }
00521   nfc_init(&context);
00522   if (context == NULL) {
00523     ERR("Unable to init libnfc (malloc)");
00524     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00525   }
00526 
00527 // Try to open the NFC reader
00528   pnd = nfc_open(context, NULL);
00529   if (pnd == NULL) {
00530     ERR("Error opening NFC reader");
00531     nfc_exit(context);
00532     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00533   }
00534 
00535   if (nfc_initiator_init(pnd) < 0) {
00536     nfc_perror(pnd, "nfc_initiator_init");
00537     nfc_close(pnd);
00538     nfc_exit(context);
00539     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00540   };
00541 
00542 // Let the reader only try once to find a tag
00543   if (nfc_device_set_property_bool(pnd, NP_INFINITE_SELECT, false) < 0) {
00544     nfc_perror(pnd, "nfc_device_set_property_bool");
00545     nfc_close(pnd);
00546     nfc_exit(context);
00547     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00548   }
00549 // Disable ISO14443-4 switching in order to read devices that emulate Mifare Classic with ISO14443-4 compliance.
00550   nfc_device_set_property_bool(pnd, NP_AUTO_ISO14443_4, false);
00551 
00552   printf("NFC reader: %s opened\n", nfc_device_get_name(pnd));
00553 
00554 // Try to find a MIFARE Classic tag
00555   if (nfc_initiator_select_passive_target(pnd, nmMifare, NULL, 0, &nt) <= 0) {
00556     printf("Error: no tag was found\n");
00557     nfc_close(pnd);
00558     nfc_exit(context);
00559     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00560   }
00561 // Test if we are dealing with a MIFARE compatible tag
00562   if ((nt.nti.nai.btSak & 0x08) == 0) {
00563     printf("Warning: tag is probably not a MFC!\n");
00564   }
00565 
00566 // Get the info from the current tag
00567   pbtUID = nt.nti.nai.abtUid;
00568 
00569   if (bUseKeyFile) {
00570     uint8_t fileUid[4];
00571     memcpy(fileUid, mtKeys.amb[0].mbm.abtUID, 4);
00572 // Compare if key dump UID is the same as the current tag UID, at least for the first 4 bytes
00573     if (memcmp(pbtUID, fileUid, 4) != 0) {
00574       printf("Expected MIFARE Classic card with UID starting as: %02x%02x%02x%02x\n",
00575              fileUid[0], fileUid[1], fileUid[2], fileUid[3]);
00576       printf("Got card with UID starting as:                     %02x%02x%02x%02x\n",
00577              pbtUID[0], pbtUID[1], pbtUID[2], pbtUID[3]);
00578       if (! bForceKeyFile) {
00579         printf("Aborting!\n");
00580         nfc_close(pnd);
00581         nfc_exit(context);
00582         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00583       }
00584     }
00585   }
00586   printf("Found MIFARE Classic card:\n");
00587   print_nfc_target(&nt, false);
00588 
00589 // Guessing size
00590   if ((nt.nti.nai.abtAtqa[1] & 0x02) == 0x02)
00591 // 4K
00592     uiBlocks = 0xff;
00593   else if ((nt.nti.nai.btSak & 0x01) == 0x01)
00594 // 320b
00595     uiBlocks = 0x13;
00596   else
00597 // 1K/2K, checked through RATS
00598     uiBlocks = 0x3f;
00599 // Testing RATS
00600   int res;
00601   if ((res = get_rats()) > 0) {
00602     if ((res >= 10) && (abtRx[5] == 0xc1) && (abtRx[6] == 0x05)
00603         && (abtRx[7] == 0x2f) && (abtRx[8] == 0x2f)
00604         && ((nt.nti.nai.abtAtqa[1] & 0x02) == 0x00)) {
00605       // MIFARE Plus 2K
00606       uiBlocks = 0x7f;
00607     }
00608     // Chinese magic emulation card, ATS=0978009102:dabc1910
00609     if ((res == 9)  && (abtRx[5] == 0xda) && (abtRx[6] == 0xbc)
00610         && (abtRx[7] == 0x19) && (abtRx[8] == 0x10)) {
00611       magic2 = true;
00612     }
00613   }
00614   printf("Guessing size: seems to be a %i-byte card\n", (uiBlocks + 1) * 16);
00615 
00616   if (bUseKeyFile) {
00617     FILE *pfKeys = fopen(argv[4], "rb");
00618     if (pfKeys == NULL) {
00619       printf("Could not open keys file: %s\n", argv[4]);
00620       exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00621     }
00622     if (fread(&mtKeys, 1, (uiBlocks + 1) * sizeof(mifare_classic_block), pfKeys) != (uiBlocks + 1) * sizeof(mifare_classic_block)) {
00623       printf("Could not read keys file: %s\n", argv[4]);
00624       fclose(pfKeys);
00625       exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00626     }
00627     fclose(pfKeys);
00628   }
00629 
00630   if (atAction == ACTION_READ) {
00631     memset(&mtDump, 0x00, sizeof(mtDump));
00632   } else {
00633     FILE *pfDump = fopen(argv[3], "rb");
00634 
00635     if (pfDump == NULL) {
00636       printf("Could not open dump file: %s\n", argv[3]);
00637       exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00638 
00639     }
00640 
00641     if (fread(&mtDump, 1, (uiBlocks + 1) * sizeof(mifare_classic_block), pfDump) != (uiBlocks + 1) * sizeof(mifare_classic_block)) {
00642       printf("Could not read dump file: %s\n", argv[3]);
00643       fclose(pfDump);
00644       exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00645     }
00646     fclose(pfDump);
00647   }
00648 // printf("Successfully opened required files\n");
00649 
00650   if (atAction == ACTION_READ) {
00651     if (read_card(unlock)) {
00652       printf("Writing data to file: %s ...", argv[3]);
00653       fflush(stdout);
00654       FILE *pfDump = fopen(argv[3], "wb");
00655       if (pfDump == NULL) {
00656         printf("Could not open dump file: %s\n", argv[3]);
00657         nfc_close(pnd);
00658         nfc_exit(context);
00659         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00660       }
00661       if (fwrite(&mtDump, 1, (uiBlocks + 1) * sizeof(mifare_classic_block), pfDump) != ((uiBlocks + 1) * sizeof(mifare_classic_block))) {
00662         printf("\nCould not write to file: %s\n", argv[3]);
00663         fclose(pfDump);
00664         nfc_close(pnd);
00665         nfc_exit(context);
00666         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00667       }
00668       printf("Done.\n");
00669       fclose(pfDump);
00670     }
00671   } else if (atAction == ACTION_WRITE) {
00672     write_card(unlock);
00673   }
00674 
00675   nfc_close(pnd);
00676   nfc_exit(context);
00677   exit(EXIT_SUCCESS);
00678 }
Generated on Fri Apr 5 2013 16:09:19 for libnfc by   1.7.6.1
